Name: Warren Buffett
Description: Invest like the oracle himself! View the stocks that Warren Buffett holds in the Berkshire Hathaway portfolio.

Name: Carl Icahn
Description: With a net worth of over $16 billion, Icahn is the founder and manager of Icahn Enterprises. Icahn has developed a reputation as a corporate raider.

Name: David Einhorn
Description: Einhorn fund has generated an annualized return of 16.5% from 1996 to 2016. His firm, Greenlight Capital, now manages over $9 billion.

Name: Nelson Peltz
Description: Nelson Peltz is the activist investor leading Trian Fund Management.

Name: Bruce Berkowitz
Description: In 2009, he was named the DS Fund Manager of the Decade by Morningstar, Inc.

Name: George Soros
Description: With an estimated net worth of over $25 billion, Soros is considered by some to be one of the most successful investors in the world.

Name: David Tepper
Description: In 2017 Forbes listed Tepper as one of the 25 highest-earning hedge fund managers. He's the founder of Appaloosa Management.

Name: Bill Ackman
Description: Ackman is the founder of Pershing Square Capital Management. Ackman a known contrarian investor also he considers himself an activist investor.

Name: Chase Coleman III
Description: Chase Coleman is the investor leading Tiger Global Management.

Name: Larry Robbins
Description: Larry Robbins is the investor leading Glenview Capital Management.

Name: Daniel Loeb
Description: Daniel Loeb is the activist investor leading Third Point.

Name: Tom Steyer
Description: Farallon Capital Management LLC is an American investment firm that manages capital on behalf of institutions and individuals. The firm was founded in 1986 by Tom Steyer, an American billionaire hedge fund manager.

Name: Charles Munger
Description: Charles Munger is a billionaire investor, businessman, author, and philanthropist. He is most well-known for his vice chairmanship of Berkshire Hathaway, the giant led by Warren Buffett.

Name: Stephen Mandel Jr
Description: Stephen Mandel is the president and portfolio manager of Lone Pine Capital. Lone Pine Capital was established in 1997 as an hedge fund, based in Greenwich, Connecticut.

Name: Julian Robertson Jr
Fund: Tiger Global Management LLC (no longer with)
Description: Julian Robertson founded Tiger Management, also known as 'The Tiger Fund'. Tiger Management is a family office and hedge fund that began investing in 1980 and was closed to outside investors in March 2000.

Name: Jim Simons
Description: https://www.bloomberg.com/profile/company/19889Z:US

Name: Ray Dalio
Description: https://www.bloomberg.com/profile/person/1801626

Name: Stephen Schwarzman
Description: https://www.bloomberg.com/profile/person/1404170

Name: Steve Cohen
Description: https://www.bloomberg.com/profile/company/1396018D:US

Name: Kenneth Griffin
Description: https://www.bloomberg.com/profile/company/3832212Z:US

Name: Philip Anschutz
Description: His Anschutz Entertainment Group operates more than 100 arenas and concert venues worldwide.

Name: David Shaw
Description: A former computer science professor at Columbia University, David Shaw is the founder of D.E. Shaw, which manages over $50 billion in assets

Name: Eli Broad
Fund: Sunamerica Asset Management, LLC (no longer with)
Description: Eli Broad bought his first real estate at age 20 and cofounded home builder Kaufman & Broad in 1957 with $12,500 borrowed from his in-laws.

Name: Israel Englander
Description: Israel Englander founded Millennium Management in 1989 with $35 million. Now, the hedge fund firm manages more than $38 billion.

Name: John Overdeck
Description: John Overdeck is the co-founder of Two Sigma Investments, a quantitative trading powerhouse with $60 billion under management.

Name: David Siegel
Description: David Alan Siegel is an American businessman who founded Westgate Resorts Ltd, a Florida-based timeshare resort firm where he serves as president and chief executive officer.

Name: Bruce Kovner
Description: Bruce Kovner is chairman of CAM Capital, founded in 2012, which manages his personal investment and business portfolios.

Name: Paul Tudor Jones II
Description: Hedge fund manager Paul Tudor Jones II is known for his macro trades, particularly his bets on interest rates and currencies.

Name: Robert Ziff
Fund: Ziff Davis / Ziff Brothers Investments, LLC
Description: The brothers' late father, William Jr., built up Ziff Davis, published PC Magazine and Car and Driver, and sold the company for $1.4 billion in 1994.

Name: Daniel Ziff
Fund: Ziff Davis / Ziff Brothers Investments, LLC
Description: Daniel Ziff and brothers Robert and Dirk inherited a fortune that dates back to 1927 when their grandfather cofounded publishing company Ziff Davis

Name: Dirk Ziff
Fund: Ziff Davis / Ziff Brothers Investments, LLC
Description: Dirk Ziff and his brothers Robert and Daniel inherited a fortune from their grandfather, who cofounded publishing company Ziff Davis in 1927.

Name: Stanley Druckenmiller
Description: Stanley Druckenmiller made it big as a hedge fund manager for 30 years. He now manages his money through a family office.

Name: John Paulson
Description: His hedge fund firm, Paulson & Co., was started in 1994 and enjoyed success as a niche fund until Paulson put on his "big short."

Name: Michael Milken
Description: https://sec.report/CIK/0001045218

Name: Paul Singer
Description: He founded his hedge fund firm, Elliott Management, in 1977 with $1.3 million. The firm now has some $35 billion in assets under management.

Name: Ken Langone
Description: In 1978, Ken Langone made an early investment in Home Depot and became a cofounder with Arthur Blank and Bernard Marcus, now billionaires.

Name: John Arnold
Description: In 2018 Arnold and wife Laura restructured their philanthropic activities into Arnold Ventures LLC, which employs more than 80 people.

Name: Leon G. Cooperman
Description: Cooperman founded Omega Advisors in 1991, a hedge fund known for strong performance; he shut down the fund at the end of 2018.

Name: Daniel Och
Description: Dan Och founded Och-Ziff Capital Management, now a publicly traded hedge fund firm, 25 years ago.

Name: Ira Rennert
Description: Ira Rennert is the founder of the Renco Group, an industrial empire with estimated annual revenues of $5 billion.

Name: Steven Klinsky
Fund: Klinsky Steven B / New Mountain Capital
Description: Klinsky founded $20 billion in assets private equity firm New Mountain Capital in 1999, one of the buyout industry's top performing firms.

Name: Mark Walter
Description: Mark Walter is CEO of investment firm Guggenheim Partners, which has some $270 billion in assets under management.

Name: Peter Kellogg
Description: After selling to Goldman in 2000, Kellogg turned his attention to reinsurance outfit IAT, which he led as CEO until 2015 and still chairs.

Name: Noam Gottesman
Description: Noam Gottesman cofounded hedge fund GLG Partners in 1995, which started out as a subsidiary of Lehman Brothers.

Name: Antony Ressler
Description: Ressler owns a minority stake in the Milwaukee Brewers baseball team and is the majority owner of the NBA's Atlanta Hawks.

Name: Jim Coulter
Description: Jim Coulter is co-CEO and founding partner of private equity giant TPG, which has $84 billion in assets under management.

Name: Herbert Wertheim
Description: He founded and still runs Brain Power Inc., a manufacturer of optical tints for eyeglasses; it holds more than 100 patents and copyrights.

Name: Ron Baron
Description: Ron Baron is the CEO of Baron Funds, a money management firm he founded in 1982; it has $30 billion in assets under management as of September 2019.

Name: Bruce Karsh
Description: Bruce Karsh runs Los Angeles-based private equity firm Oaktree Capital Management with longtime partner Howard Marks; they founded it in 1995.

Name: James Dinan
Description: James Dinan founded York Capital Management in 1991 and is the chairman, CEO and a managing partner of the money management firm.

Name: Brian Sheth
Description: Brian Sheth cofounded private equity firm Vista Equity Partners in 2000 with Robert Smith.

Name: Dan Loeb
Description: Dan Loeb is the founder of Third Point, a hedge fund that manages some $15 billion.

Name: Warren Stephens
Description: Stephens Inc., his Little Rock investment bank, was founded by his uncle Witt in 1933; his father Jackson joined in 1946.

Name: Henry Laufer
Description: Laufer joined legendary quantitative hedge fund Renaissance Technologies, founded by Jim Simons, in 1992.

Name: David Gottesman
Description: A Harvard Business School graduate, Gottesman co-founded the investment firm First Manhattan Co., which was an early investor in Berkshire Hathaway.

Name: Jeffrey Gundlach
Description: Gundlach is the cofounder of mutual fund company, DoubleLine Capital, which manages more than $140 billion in assets.

Name: Glenn Dubin
Description: Dubin's fortune comes from Highbridge Capital, which he cofounded in 1992 and then sold to JP Morgan Chase in 2004.

Name: Henry Swieca
Description: A Wall Street veteran, Henry Swieca cofounded hedge fund firm Highbridge Capital Management in 1992 with childhood friend Glenn Dubin.

Name: Marc Lasry
Description: Marc Lasry and his sister Sonia founded Avenue Capital Management in 1995 with $7 million in funding from friends and family.

Name: Jeffrey Talpins
Description: Jeffrey Talpins runs Element Capital Management, a hedge fund firm with $17 billion under management that specializes in macro trading.

Name: J. Tomilson Hill
Description: Mergers and acquisitions maven J. Tomilson "Tom" Hill started off his career at investment bank First Boston, where he cofounded the M&A department.

Name: Brian Higgins
Description: Brian Higgins is the cofounder of King Street Capital Management, a distressed-debt focused hedge fund.

Name: O. Francis Biondi
Description: O. Francis Biondi cofounded hedge fund King Street Capital Management in 1995 with fellow First Boston alum Brian Higgins.

Name: Nicolas Berggruen
Description: He first worked in real estate for Bass Brothers Enterprises before founding Berggruen Holdings in 1985 to manage his family fortune.

Name: Louis Bacon
Description: One of Wall Street's macro-trading legends, Louis Bacon cut his teeth as a commodities and currencies trader, earning big profits in the 1987 crash.

Name: Seth Klarman
Description: Investment legend Seth Klarman runs Boston-based firm Baupost. With $27 billion under management, Baupost is one of the largest hedge funds.

Name: Bill Gross
Description: Gross cofounded PIMCO, an investment management firm, in 1971 and became known as a superstar bond fund manager.

Name: David Booth
Description: When David Booth cofounded Dimensional Fund Advisors in 1981, he began a decades-long experiment in applying academic theory to real-world investing.

Name: Hamilton James
Description: Hamilton "Tony" James was recruited to Blackstone Group in 2002 to help run its rapidly-expanding private equity and asset management business.

Name: Ron Burkle
Description: He formed investment firm Yucaipa in 1986 and bagged big returns buying and selling supermarket chains Fred Meyer, Jurgensen's, Ralphs and others.

Name: Sue Gross
Description: Sue Gross is the ex-wife of PIMCO cofounder and billionaire Bill Gross. The two divorced in 2017 after 32 years of marriage.

Name: Philippe Laffont
Description: Philippe Laffont runs Coatue Management, a hedge fund and venture capital that focusses on technology-themed investing.

Name: Herbert Allen Jr
Description: Herbert "Herb" A. Allen controls boutique investment bank Allen & Co., which focuses on tech companies.

Name: Fayez Sarofim
Description: Octogenarian investment manager Fayez Sarofim is chairman and Co-Chief Investment Officer of money management firm Fayez Sarofim & Co.

Name: Joseph Edelman
Description: Edelman founded Perceptive Advisors in 1999 and focuses on investing in biotechnology stocks.

Name: J Christopher Flowers
Description: J. Christopher Flowers runs private equity firm J.C. Flowers & Co., which focuses on the financial services sector.

Name: Michael Price
Description: Price began his career in finance as a research assistant at Heine Securities in 1975 and bought the company after Michael Heine died in 1988.

Name: Richard Kayne
Description: Richard Kayne cofounded alternative asset manager Kayne Anderson Capital Advisors.

Name: Michael Steinhardt
Description: Steinhardt cofounded Birthright Israel, a foundation that provides funding for young Jewish Americans to take heritage trips to Israel.

Name: Lowell Milken
Description: Lowell Milken is the younger brother and the former right-hand man of former financier Michael Milken.

Name: Carl Thoma
Description: After about a hundred calls, Bravo’s résumé caught the eye of Carl Thoma, a founding partner of the Chicago-based private equity firm Golder, Thoma, Cressey, Rauner (now known as GTCR), and they hit it off.
